title: Toddler attacked by dog in family home rushed to hospital with injuries
text:

A toddler has been taken to hospital after being attacked by a family dog.

The one-year-old child was attacked at an east Hull home tonight.

Humberside Police were called to the Preston Road area of the city's east on Saturday evening.

The child has been taken to Hull Royal Infirmary for treatment of their injuries, which are not thought to be life-threatening, reports Hull Live .

The dog has been contained and officers are deciding what to do with it.

The call was among 187 incidents dealt with by police in Hull so far on Saturday evening.

A mum recently warned of the dangers of unrestrained dogs after her little girl suffered savage injuries in a Labrador attack at her aunt's farm.

Lily-Fay Parfitt was left screaming in agony with "life-changing" wounds to her cheek and lip when the dog attacked without warning early last month at the farm in Pulborough, West Sussex.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

Mum Kelly Parfitt claimed surgeons ranked the nine-year-old's injuries as a 9.5 out of 10 on an injury severity scale.

The mum-of-five spoke out to warn others that all dog breeds can be dangerous and to keep pets on short leads around children.

Lily-Fay had to have 192 stitches on the outside of her cheek to hold it together, 38 stitches in her lip and an unknown number inside her cheek.

The dog took off so much skin that the young girl lost 25 percent of her top lip.

The incident was reported to Sussex Police and Kelly said she believed the dog had been destroyed.
description: The child was rushed to hospital after being attacked a family dog at an east Hull home
